intro: Galium ciliare subsp. terminale, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves with ciliate margins. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This subspecies is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is noted for its delicate appearance and ecological importance.
